intro: Cacalia verbascoides, commonly known as the yellow toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its yellow, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. It has opposite, hairy leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Cacalia verbascoides is considered a perennial herb and is adapted to arid environments.
